snippet: A court ruled that Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra had abused her power in 2011. The decision was a victory for protesters who have sought to overthrow the government.
abstract: Thai court orders Prime Min Yingluck Shinawatra removed from office, divisive move that represent a victory for opposition movement that has sought to overthrow government for six months; court says Yingluck abused her power when she transferred a civil servant to different job three years earlier; decision calls into question upcoming elections, which governing party was expected to win.
lead_paragraph: A court ruled that Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra had abused her power in 2011. The decision was a victory for protesters who have sought to overthrow the government.

headline.main: Thai Prime Minister Ordered Removed From Office
headline.print_headline: Thai Prime Minister Ordered Removed From Office
